title: Skull and Crossbones

adjectives: Causing death; deadly, fatal, killing, lethal (now only of wounds, injuries etc.).
Causing death or having the ability to cause death.
Causing or capable of causing death
verbs: To use poison to kill or paralyse somebody
To use poison to kill or paralyse.
nouns: An emotion experienced in anticipation of some specific pain or danger (usually accompanied by a desire to flee or fight)
An emotion experienced in anticipation of some specific pain or danger.

Fear is an emotion induced by a threat perceived by living entities, which causes a change in brain and organ function and ultimately a change in behavior, such as running away, hiding or freezing from traumatic events.
Uncountable: emotion caused by actual or perceived danger or threat.
Basic emotion induced by a perceived threat
Associated with dread, an emotion
A strong, uncontrollable, unpleasant emotion caused by actual or perceived danger or threat.
Fear is a basic emotional sensation and response system initiated by an aversion to some perceived risk or threat.
A content descriptor developed by the Pan European Gaming Information (PEGI) and the British Board of Film Classification (BBFC).
The skull is a bony structure in the head of most vertebrates that supports the structures of the face and forms a protective cavity for the brain.
Bony structure in the head
The bony framework of the head.
The bony skeleton of the head of vertebrates
An outline of a human skull and two crossed bones; a symbol of death traditionally used on the Jolly Roger, but now used as a warning on poisons.
Symbol of death.
Emblem warning of danger or death
Poison warning sign
A skull and crossbones is a symbol consisting of a human skull and two long bones crossed together under the skull.
A symbol consisting of a human skull and two bones crossed together under the skull.
A monstrous thing, person or act.
Someone or something that is markedly unusual.
A horribly deformed person.
A person or animal that is markedly unusual or deformed
In current usage, the word "freak" is commonly used to refer to a person with something strikingly unusual about their appearance or behavior.
Person or thing that is monstrous.
Monstrous thing, person or act.
Unusual person
Behemoth is a beast mentioned in.
Any creature or thing of gigantic size.
Someone or something that is abnormally large and powerful
A great and mighty beast God shows Job in Job 40:15-24.
Bizarre or whimsical creature.
Biblical creature
Any large person or thing; someone or something that is abnormally large or powerful.
A bizarre or whimsical creature.
Death is the permanent end of the life of a biological organism.
The cessation of life and all associated processes; the end of an organism's existence as an entity independent from its environment and its return to an inert, nonliving state.
Death is the termination of all biological functions that sustain a living organism.
The event of dying or departure from life
Permanent cessation of life
The cessation of life and all associated processes.
The permanent cessation of all biological functions that sustain a particular living organism
Departure, especially departure from this life
Departure, especially departure from this life; death.
An instance or cause of liable harm.
Instance or cause of liable harm.
The condition of being susceptible to harm or injury
A substance that is harmful or lethal to a living organism.

In the context of biology, poisons are substances that cause disturbances to organisms, usually by chemical reaction or other activity on the molecular scale, when a sufficient quantity is absorbed by an organism.
Poisons are substances that can cause disturbances to organisms, usually by chemical reaction or other activity on the molecular scale, when a sufficient quantity is absorbed by an organism.
Substance that causes disturbances to organisms
Any substance that causes injury or illness or death of a living organism
Substances that can harm or kill.
A toxic or poisonous substance
Substance harmful to a living organism.
A chemical compound having an effect on living organisms
A toxicant is any toxic substance.

A substance which, when ingested, inhaled, or absorbed, or when applied to, injected into, or developed within the body, in relatively small amounts, may cause injury, harm, or destruction to organs, tissue, or life.

description:
A cartoon human skull atop an X-shaped pair of bones, as on a pirate flag or poison symbol. Samsung’s design previously displayed a skull and crossbones on a yellow triangle, indicating a hazardous material.

May represent various ideas of death or danger, e.g., dying from laughter or killing it with great skill. May also represent various pirate characters or mascots.

Popular around Halloween. Not to be confused with üíÄ Skull, though their applications may overlap.
apple_vendor_description: The skull and crossbones emoji on Apple devices presents a stark, bone-white skull with deep, shadowed eye sockets, rendered with Apple's signature smooth gradients and subtle 3D shading. Its slightly rounded edges lend a touch of polish to the otherwise grim symbol, evoking a sense of danger, warning, or a playful, dramatic flair in digital communication. This iconic emblem, as seen on your iPhone or iPad, carries a universally understood message of peril or a lighthearted nod to something extreme.
